channel.title: github on Jean Bilheux
channel.description: Recent content in github on Jean Bilheux

item.title: How to remove a file from git tracking
item.description: Let’s suppose you have a file you have been updated for a while (ex: .idea/workspace.xml) in your git repository but decided to remove it. You need to update your .gitignore file and add this file .idea/workspace.xml Remove all tracking files by cleaning the cached git rm -r –cached . commit changes git add . git commit -m “Here it is” git push

item.title: What my .gitignore file looks like
item.description: When working with notebooks and python projects, here is what my .gitignore file looks like. __pycache__ *.py[cod] .ipynb* .coverage /cover/* # mac .DS_Store .cache # Packages *.egg *.egg-info dist build eggs parts bin var sdist MANIFEST # Unit test / coverage reports .coverage
